title: Urban Waste Collection & Recycling Bin Distribution
content:
A municipal waste management company operates trucks (capacity: `<capacity>`) from a depot (`<loc_depot>`) to collect mixed waste from `<num_customer>` residential areas (`<loc_customer>`, demand: `<demand_linehaul>`) while simultaneously distributing empty recycling bins to incentivize waste separation (pickup demand: `<demand_backhaul>`). Each truck’s route must:  
- Avoid overloading by balancing collected waste and distributed bins.  
- Complete all tasks within a `<time_limit>`-hour shift to comply with labor laws.  
- Minimize total distance to reduce fuel costs and emissions.

title: Farm-to-Table Produce Delivery & Empty Crate Retrieval
content:
A local farm uses refrigerated vans (capacity: `<capacity>`) to deliver fresh produce to `<num_customer>` restaurants (`<loc_customer>`, delivery demand: `<demand_linehaul>`) and collect empty crates for reuse (pickup demand: `<demand_backhaul>`). Challenges:  
- Vans must prioritize perishable deliveries but can mix pickups if capacity allows.  
- Routes must finish within `<distance_limit>` km to ensure food freshness and driver schedules.  
- Optimize for minimal refrigeration runtime to save energy.

title: Library Bookmobile & Donation Pickup Service
content:
A mobile library service starts at `<loc_depot>` with vehicles (capacity: `<capacity>`) to:  
- Deliver reserved books to `<num_customer>` community stops (`<loc_customer>`, demand: `<demand_linehaul>`).

- Maximize access to underserved neighborhoods.

- Deliver nursery frames and juvenile corals (<demand_linehaul>), and  
- Collect mature coral fragments and genetic samples (<demand_backhaul>).  
Routes must balance delivery/pickup operations while accounting for tidal currents that impose a <time_limit> on safe navigation windows. Mixed backhauls enable efficient sampling during the same trip as nursery maintenance.

title: Industrial 3D Printer Material Supply & Printed Part Retrieval
content:
An additive manufacturing hub services distributed factories with on-demand part printing. Delivery vans (capacity <capacity>) originating at <loc_depot> must:  
- Transport raw printing materials (<demand_linehaul>) to <num_customer> facilities (<loc_customer>), and  
- Retrieve completed printed components (<demand_backhaul>).  
Routes are constrained by material expiration timelines (<time_limit>) and allow mixed backhauls to optimize just-in-time logistics for critical manufacturing processes.

title: Mobile Data Center Cooling Unit Rotation
content:
A cloud provider operates a network of edge data centers requiring periodic coolant maintenance. Specialized trucks (capacity <capacity>) from <loc_depot> visit <num_customer> locations (<loc_customer>) to:  
- Deliver charged cooling units (<demand_linehaul>), and  
- Retrieve spent units for recharging (<demand_backhaul>).  
Mixed backhauls allow adaptive routing based on real-time thermal sensor data, while <time_limit> ensures temperature-sensitive equipment never exceeds safe operating durations without cooling.

title: Archaeological Site Equipment Sharing Network
content:
A research consortium circulates specialized excavation tools among <num_customer> dig sites (<loc_customer>). Vehicles (capacity <capacity>) based at <loc_depot> must:  
- Transport requested equipment (<demand_linehaul>) to active excavations, and  
- Retrieve idle tools (<demand_backhaul>) from completed work areas.  
Routes must complete within <time_limit> to align with fieldwork schedules, with mixed backhauls enabling dynamic tool redistribution based on changing archaeological priorities.
```  

These scenarios emphasize:  
1) **Novel domains** (marine conservation, additive manufacturing, edge computing)  
2) **Clear mixed backhaul dynamics** with bidirectional material flows  
3) **Duration limits** tied to operational constraints (tidal windows, material expiration, equipment safety)  
4) **Capacity constraints** for specialized transport units  
5) **Absence of time windows/open routes** per requirements  

Each maintains the VRPMBL structure while introducing fresh contexts beyond traditional logistics.

title: Mobile EV Battery Swapping & Depleted Battery Collection
content: A fleet of service vehicles operates a battery-swapping network for electric vehicles (EVs) in urban areas. Each vehicle starts at a central depot (<loc_depot>) with fresh batteries (<capacity> units) and visits EV charging stations (<loc_customer>) to both deliver charged batteries (<demand_linehaul>) and collect depleted ones (<demand_backhaul>). Routes must be planned to ensure: 1) no vehicle exceeds its battery-carrying capacity, 2) total route duration stays within <time_limit> hours due to battery temperature control requirements, and 3) mixed-order service is allowed to optimize station coverage. The goal is to minimize total fleet mileage while maintaining battery availability across the network.

title: Antarctic Research Equipment Resupply & Ice Core Retrieval
content: A logistics team coordinates snowcat vehicles to simultaneously deliver sensitive equipment to remote research stations (<loc_customer>) and retrieve ice core samples from drilling sites across Antarctica. Vehicles depart from McMurdo Station (<loc_depot>) with <capacity> tons of gear, must complete routes within <time_limit> days due to extreme weather windows, and can freely alternate between delivering equipment (<demand_linehaul>) and collecting ice cores (<demand_backhaul>). The challenge is optimizing routes that respect vehicle capacity, prevent sample thawing by minimizing transit time, and account for constantly changing terrain conditions that affect travel duration.

title: Reusable Packaging Network for Industrial Parts
content: An automotive manufacturer operates a closed-loop system where specialized containers (<capacity> units/vehicle) transport precision components to assembly plants (<demand_linehaul>) while simultaneously retrieving used containers from those locations (<demand_backhaul>). Vehicles starting at the distribution center (<loc_depot>) must visit plants in any order, with routes constrained to <time_limit> hours to meet just-in-time production schedules. The mixed backhaul nature allows empty container collection en route to delivery stops, requiring careful load balancing to avoid exceeding vehicle capacity during multi-stop operations.

title: Mobile Museum Exhibit Circulation & Artifact Retrieval
content: A cultural heritage organization manages a fleet of climate-controlled trucks that both deliver traveling exhibits to regional museums (<loc_customer>) and retrieve artifacts loaned to those institutions. Each vehicle (<capacity> cubic meters) departs from a conservation center (<loc_depot>), with routes limited to <time_limit> hours due to humidity control requirements. The mixed backhaul capability allows flexible sequencing of exhibit drop-offs (<demand_linehaul>) and artifact pickups (<demand_backhaul>), but must prevent overcrowding of fragile items during transport. The objective is maximizing cultural access while minimizing vibration exposure through optimized routing.

title: Coral Reef Restoration Supply Chain
content: A marine conservation team operates boats to deliver coral fragments to restoration sites (<demand_linehaul>) while collecting monitoring equipment from previously seeded locations (<demand_backhaul>). Vessels departing from a coastal nursery (<loc_depot>) have limited holding tank capacity (<capacity>) for live coral and must complete routes within <time_limit> hours to ensure fragment survival. The mixed backhaul approach allows opportunistic equipment retrieval during delivery runs, but requires careful planning to avoid exceeding biological carrying capacity or violating dive team work-hour restrictions.

title: Mobile EV Battery Swapping & Depleted Battery Collection
content: A fleet of service vehicles operates a battery-swapping network for electric vehicles (EVs) in urban areas. Each vehicle starts at a central depot (<loc_depot>) with fresh batteries (<demand_linehaul>) and visits EV charging stations (<loc_customer>) to replace depleted batteries (<demand_backhaul>). Vehicles have a limited battery capacity (<capacity>) and must complete routes within a strict shift duration (<time_limit>) to ensure timely service. The challenge is to optimize routes for simultaneous delivery and pickup while respecting vehicle constraints.

title: Antarctic Research Equipment Resupply & Ice Core Retrieval
content: A logistics team supports Antarctic research stations by delivering scientific equipment (<demand_linehaul>) and retrieving ice core samples (<demand_backhaul>) from remote field sites (<loc_customer>). Vehicles (snowcats) depart from a base station (<loc_depot>) with limited cargo space (<capacity>) and operational windows (<time_limit>) due to extreme weather. Routes must balance delivery/pickup sequencing and avoid overloading vehicles while minimizing travel time in hazardous conditions.

title: Reusable Packaging Network for Industrial Parts
content: An automotive manufacturer uses reusable containers to ship parts to assembly plants (<loc_customer>) and return empty containers to suppliers (<demand_backhaul>). Trucks with fixed capacity (<capacity>) depart from a distribution center (<loc_depot>), delivering parts (<demand_linehaul>) and collecting empties in any order. Daily route durations (<time_limit>) are constrained by driver shifts. The goal is to minimize empty miles while ensuring no container shortages at plants.

title: Mobile Museum Exhibit Circulation & Artifact Retrieval
content: A cultural heritage organization rotates fragile exhibits between museums (<loc_customer>) using specialized climate-controlled trucks. Vehicles start at a storage facility (<loc_depot>), deliver new exhibits (<demand_linehaul>), and retrieve outgoing artifacts (<demand_backhaul>). Each truck has strict weight limits (<capacity>) and route duration constraints (<time_limit>) to preserve artifacts. Routes must avoid unnecessary vibrations and prioritize safe handling sequences.

title: Coral Reef Restoration Supply Chain
content: A marine conservation team deploys coral fragments (<demand_linehaul>) to restoration sites (<loc_customer>) via boats while collecting damaged fragments (<demand_backhaul>) for rehabilitation. Boats depart from a nursery (<loc_depot>) with limited live cargo capacity (<capacity>) and must complete routes within tidal windows (<time_limit>). Optimizing mixed delivery/pickup sequences is critical to maximize coral survival rates.

title: Mobile Vaccine Clinic & Medical Waste Collection
content: A healthcare provider operates mobile vaccination units that visit rural communities (<loc_customer>) to administer vaccines (<demand_linehaul>) while simultaneously collecting used syringes and medical waste (<demand_backhaul>). Vehicles with capacity <capacity> depart from regional hospitals (<loc_depot>) and must complete routes within <time_limit> hours due to vaccine temperature stability requirements. The mixed nature of deliveries and collections requires careful capacity management along each route.

title: Reusable Shipping Container Network for Automotive Parts
content: An auto manufacturer circulates specialized containers between parts suppliers (<loc_customer>) and assembly plants. Vehicles with capacity <capacity> deliver empty containers to suppliers (<demand_backhaul>) while collecting filled containers (<demand_linehaul>) in any sequence. Routes are constrained by <distance_limit> km due to just-in-time production schedules, requiring balanced workload distribution across the fleet.

title: Floating Laboratory Equipment Rotation for Ocean Research
content: Research vessels with capacity <capacity> service an array of ocean monitoring buoys (<loc_customer>), delivering fresh sensors (<demand_linehaul>) and retrieving data-packed equipment (<demand_backhaul>). Mixed service sequences are necessary to optimize limited vessel time at sea (<time_limit> days), with strict capacity constraints for delicate instruments.

title: Urban Vertical Farm Produce Delivery & Compost Collection
content: Electric delivery trucks (<capacity>) distribute fresh produce from rooftop farms (<loc_depot>) to restaurants (<loc_customer>, <demand_linehaul>) while collecting food waste for composting (<demand_backhaul>). Battery life limits routes to <distance_limit> km, requiring efficient mixing of delivery and collection stops within vehicle capacity.

title: Mobile Semiconductor Wafer Fab Service
content:
Specialized trucks service chip fabrication plants (<loc_customer>) by delivering pristine silicon wafers (<demand_linehaul>) and collecting processed wafers (<demand_backhaul>) in any order. Vehicles with cleanroom capacity <capacity> must complete routes within <time_limit> hours due to wafer sensitivity, with strict contamination prevention protocols affecting load management.
``` 

These scenarios emphasize the mixed backhaul capability while incorporating capacity constraints and duration limits, without involving time windows or strict backhaul sequencing requirements. Each presents unique operational challenges that would benefit from VRPMBL optimization.

title: Mobile Solar Panel Cleaning & Maintenance Fleet
content: A renewable energy company operates a fleet of mobile cleaning units to maintain solar farms across a region. Each unit starts at a central depot (<loc_depot>) and must visit solar installations (<loc_customer>) to perform two tasks: (1) deliver fresh cleaning fluid (<demand_linehaul>) and (2) collect contaminated runoff water (<demand_backhaul>). Vehicles have limited tank capacity (<capacity>) and must complete routes within <time_limit> hours due to daylight constraints. The mixed backhaul nature allows fluid delivery and waste collection to occur in any order at each site.

title: Urban Vertical Farm Harvest & Compost Distribution
content: An urban agriculture network uses electric vans to simultaneously distribute nutrient-rich compost to rooftop farms (<demand_linehaul>) while collecting harvested produce (<demand_backhaul>). Each van (<capacity>) departs from a processing center (<loc_depot>) and must complete its route within <time_limit> hours to maintain produce freshness. The mixed backhaul constraint allows flexible sequencing of compost drops and harvest pickups at each farm (<loc_customer>), optimizing for both battery range and perishability timelines.

title: Industrial 3D Printer Material Supply & Printed Part Retrieval
content: A distributed manufacturing service supplies metal powder (<demand_linehaul>) to factories with industrial 3D printers while collecting finished parts (<demand_backhaul>). Temperature-controlled trucks (<capacity>) depart from a central hub (<loc_depot>) and must visit facilities (<loc_customer>) in routes under <time_limit> hours to prevent material degradation. The mixed backhaul requirement allows material delivery and part collection to occur in any order, accommodating varying printer completion times.

title: Wildlife Tracking Collar Deployment & Data Retrieval
content: Conservation biologists use off-road vehicles to (1) deploy GPS collars (<demand_linehaul>) and (2) retrieve collars with full data storage (<demand_backhaul>) across a wildlife reserve (<loc_customer>). Each vehicle (<capacity>) starts at a research station (<loc_depot>) and must complete routes within <time_limit> hours due to animal activity patterns. The mixed backhaul constraint enables flexible sequencing of new deployments and retrievals based on real-time collar status updates.

title: Semiconductor Wafer Distribution & Used Carrier Retrieval
content: A cleanroom logistics service transports delicate silicon wafers (<demand_linehaul>) to chip fabrication plants while collecting empty wafer carriers (<demand_backhaul>). Specialized trucks (<capacity>) depart from a contamination-controlled depot (<loc_depot>) and must complete routes within <time_limit> hours to maintain sterile conditions. The mixed backhaul capability allows carriers to be collected whenever capacity permits, regardless of delivery sequence at fabs (<loc_customer>).

title: Mobile Library & Book Donation Collection
content: A regional library system operates a fleet of mobile library vans that deliver books to rural communities while simultaneously collecting donated books for redistribution. Each van has a capacity of `<capacity>` books and must complete its route within `<time_limit>` hours to ensure timely returns. The library must optimize routes to serve all stops (`<loc_customer>`) with delivery demands (`<demand_linehaul>`) and pickup requests (`<demand_backhaul>`), ensuring no van is overloaded and all routes respect duration limits.

title: Urban Green Waste Recycling & Compost Distribution
content: A city’s sustainability initiative involves trucks distributing compost to community gardens (`<demand_linehaul>`) while collecting green waste (`<demand_backhaul>`) from the same locations (`<loc_customer>`). Trucks have a `<capacity>` limit for combined loads and must return to the depot (`<loc_depot>`) within `<time_limit>` hours to avoid overtime costs. Routes must balance delivery/pickup sequences to maximize efficiency while adhering to capacity and duration constraints.

title: Oil Rig Supply & Waste Retrieval
content: A logistics company services offshore oil rigs by delivering equipment (`<demand_linehaul>`) and retrieving hazardous waste drums (`<demand_backhaul>`). Ships depart from a coastal depot (`<loc_depot>`) with a `<capacity>` limit and must complete trips within `<time_limit>` hours due to tidal conditions. Mixed backhauls are allowed, but routes must prioritize safety by avoiding overloading and ensuring timely returns.

title: Mobile Clinic & Medical Sample Collection
content: A healthcare NGO deploys mobile clinics to remote villages (`<loc_customer>`) to deliver vaccines (`<demand_linehaul>`) and collect lab samples (`<demand_backhaul>`). Vehicles have a `<capacity>` limit for medical supplies and samples, and routes must finish within `<time_limit>` hours to preserve sample integrity. The challenge is to interleave deliveries and pickups efficiently while respecting cold-chain storage constraints.

title: Reusable Packaging Logistics for Grocery Chains
content: A grocery chain uses reusable crates for deliveries to stores (`<demand_linehaul>`) and collects empty crates (`<demand_backhaul>`) from the same locations (`<loc_customer>`). Trucks with `<capacity>` limits must optimize mixed backhaul routes to minimize distance while ensuring all crates are cycled back to the depot (`<loc_depot>`) within `<time_limit>` hours to meet restocking schedules.

title: Mobile Seedling Nursery & Mature Plant Collection
content: A horticulture company operates a fleet of trucks to deliver young seedlings to urban farms and community gardens while simultaneously collecting mature plants for resale or composting. Each vehicle has a limited capacity (<capacity>) for both fresh seedlings (<demand_linehaul>) and harvested plants (<demand_backhaul>). Routes must be optimized to balance delivery/pickup sequences while respecting a maximum daily operating duration (<time_limit>) to ensure driver shifts comply with labor laws. The depot (<loc_depot>) serves 25 seasonal clients (<loc_customer>) with varying demands.

title: Industrial Tool Rental Fleet Circulation
content: A construction equipment provider manages a network of high-value tools that are delivered to job sites and retrieved when rental periods end. Vehicles (<capacity>) must transport both incoming tools (<demand_backhaul>) and outgoing rentals (<demand_linehaul>) in mixed sequences across 30 active sites (<loc_customer>). Each route is constrained by a 6-hour duration limit (<time_limit>) to prevent overtime costs, starting/ending at the central warehouse (<loc_depot>). The challenge lies in dynamically prioritizing urgent returns while maintaining delivery commitments.

title: Floating Solar Panel Maintenance & Algae Harvesting
content: A renewable energy company services offshore solar arrays using amphibious vehicles that both clean panels and harvest algae biomass. Each vessel (<capacity>) carries cleaning supplies (<demand_linehaul>) and returns with algae containers (<demand_backhaul>) across 15 floating platforms (<loc_customer>). Routes must account for tidal navigation constraints and stay within 8-hour operational windows (<time_limit>) due to battery limitations, departing from a coastal base (<loc_depot>). The mixed nature of operations requires careful capacity management during simultaneous delivery/pickup sequences.

title: Mobile Museum Artifact Exchange Program
content: A cultural heritage organization circulates fragile artifacts between regional museums using specialized climate-controlled trucks. Vehicles (<capacity>) transport both outgoing exhibits (<demand_linehaul>) and returning items (<demand_backhaul>) among 12 institutions (<loc_customer>). Strict 5-hour route durations (<time_limit>) ensure artifact safety during transit, with all routes originating at a conservation center (<loc_depot>). The solution must prevent capacity violations when handling simultaneous exchanges at museums with limited loading docks.

title: Antarctic Penguin Monitoring & Research Equipment Rotation
content: Scientists coordinate supply runs to remote penguin colonies where vehicles (<capacity>) deliver fresh sensors (<demand_linehaul>) and retrieve biological samples (<demand_backhaul>) across 10 icefield sites (<loc_customer>). Extreme conditions impose 4-hour route limits (<time_limit>) due to fuel constraints, with all trips starting at the research station (<loc_depot>). The mixed operations require strategic sequencing to ensure temperature-sensitive samples are collected before vehicle capacity is exhausted by outgoing equipment.
